But they were wrong -- because even as the marriage ceremony took place, thousands of BattleMechs stood poised to launch one of the largest military campaigns in centuries!

The BattlePack is a new and innovative game supplement that requires only the contents of the BattleTech 4th Edition boxed set to play, making it ideal for the beginning player while offering seasoned players the opportunity to experience the BattleTech universe as it began. BattlePack: Fourth Succession War is based on events in Michael Stackpole's classic Warrior Trilogy novel series. From the opening salvos until the final shots ring out, this supplement takes you step-by-step through the titanic struggle known as the Fourth Succession War.

This expansion features:

Ten new, ready-to-play scenarios.
The new, never-before-seen Woodland BattleTech map.
Eight additional BattleMech record sheets, four of which are new variants:BJ-3 Blackjack, HOP-4B Hoplite, CTF-2X Cataphract and CGR-1A5 Charger.
20 full-color stand-up playing pieces.

User comment:

This BattlePack is out of print, and it's increasingly difficult to find a complete pack that includes the playing pieces and map. Although it's described by FASA as their first BattlePack, it was also the last.

The main sourcebook itself is still useable without the pieces although just over half of the scenarios in the pack use the Woodlands Map when setting up the map. It's unclear if the map will be re-released at any point by the current licence holder, although other heavily wooded maps with hills such as the two Rolling Hills maps re-released in the Classic BattleTech Map Compilation 1 are reasonable substitutes. The four new 'Mech variants described as new with this expansion have since been re-released in various other expansions.
92615.name: BattleTech BattlePack: Fourth Succession War

92616.name: Inland Empire Core Rulebook
92616.description:
From Introduction:

This is not the world you know.

The Vikings of Old Europe were masters of the sea. Like the Irish centuries before them, they dominated the Atlantic and her coasts. Eventually, they reached out to the frigid land of glaciers at the western end of the world.

But they did not stop there.

The Vikings opened the way, and word spread of their travels to the strange new land. Europeans flowed into Terra Nova more than five hundred years before Columbus. Other nations attempted to challenge the Vikings, and some met with success.

With a new world open to them, the learned minds of Europe were able to escape the grip of the Church, and the Renaissance bloomed unchallenged in Terra Nova. Science, unhindered by restrictions from canonical overseers, progressed along different paths.

While there are astounding creations like the building-sized analytical engines or the walking automatons called mobens, they also live under primitive circumstances. Most travel is by horse, aeroship, or the occasional rail line. Though signal lines are slowly being strung across the landscape, most communication is done by pigeon, pony, or aeropost. The wealthy may enjoy a parlor lit with Tesla lights from a canter generator in the basement, but commoners make due with naptha lamps and fireplaces.

Through the acids of petty feuds and old grudges, the great nations of Terra Nova now find themselves on the brink of what was thought to be impossible: a continent-wide war.

92618.description:
From the back of the book:

Nearly three hundred years ago, the Star League was torn apart when the lies and deceits of the petty House Lords launched the Inner Sphere into endless war. The Great Father Aleksandr Kerensky led our forefathers, the remnants of the righteous Star League army, away from that chaotic despotism. In turn, his son Nicholas forged us into the Clans: a society dedicated to becoming the greatest fighting force in all of history. We grew stronger with each generation, awaiting the day when we would return to the Inner Sphere to save it from itself.

Now is the time of the Return. Some among the Clans oppose the Crusaders' campaign of conquest, but we know that true enlightenment can only come to the misguided rabble of the Successor States through total subjugation. We will crush their honorless armies with our OmniMechs and plant the flag of the Clans on sacred Terra. Only then will the true Star League have returned to the Inner Sphere.

User comment:

The companion volume to the Field Manual: Warden Clans, this volume follows up on earlier books dedicated to the Clans and gives more detail on the seven Clans identified as being Crusader clans at the time of printing. More detail is given on the five Clans that hadn't been covered in earlier sourcebook at the time, and with those Clans comes detail on more new equipment, 'Mechs and Battle Armour not seen before in the Inner Sphere.

This sourcebook is out of print, and hasn't been released in electronic format by the current license holder.
92618.name: BattleTech Field Manual: Crusader Clans

92619.description:
From the publisher's website:

Nearly three hundred years ago, the Star League was torn apart when the ambitious House Lords launched the Inner Sphere into endless war. The Great Father Aleksandr Kerensky led our forefathers, the remnants of the noble Star League army, away from that empty conflict. In turn, his son Nicholas forged us into the Clans: a society founded on unity, strength and skill. With each generation we evolved, awaiting the day when we would return to the Inner Sphere to save it from itself.

Now is the time of the Return. Some among the Clans insist that conquest of the Inner Sphere is the only Way, but we know that this path will only lead us into the chaos of the past. Our true mission is far more noble: we must act as the Wardens of the Inner Sphere until the time is right and humanity is truly reunited. Only then will the true Star League have returned to the Inner Sphere.

-- Ulric Kerensky, ilKhan of the Clans

The second of two volumes on the Clans, Field Manual: Warden Clans describes the Defenders of Kerensky's Vision: Clans Cloud Cobra, Coyote, Diamond Shark, Ghost Bear, Goliath Scorpion, Snow Raven and Steel Viper. This book describes the tactics, military doctrines and battle histories of each Clan, plus special rules that reflect the unique capabilities of each Galaxy, new weapons, equipment, exclusive Warden BattleMechs and more.

User comment:

Following up on earlier sourcebooks devoted to the Clans, this gives detail on all of those Clans identified as Warden Clans at the time of printing. Some of the Clans receive more attention than others, depending on how much detail was already in print via previous books. Along with the background detail on the Clans, the expansion also details new Battle Armour variants, a new OmniMech, a new weapon system and new Warships are all introduced in this expansion, although these items have largely been reprinted in later sourcebooks.

This book is a companion volume to the BattleTech Field Manual: Crusader Clans, and is currently out of print. The current license holder hasn't published this book as an electronic download as yet.
92619.name: BattleTech Field Manual:   Warden Clans

92620.name: Good Little Children Never Grow Up (4E)
92620.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Everybody in Hedgebird knows that the old DeMay orphanage is haunted, but that did not stop the Perseville family from moving to town and buying the place. Nor did it stop the Tarnak boys from venturing inside. Now the children are trapped inside, and to get them out the heroes must confront terrible ghosts from the orphanage’s past.

Good Little Children Never Grow Up is a horror themed adventure for five characters levels 3-5. You can run it either as a one shot adventure or as part of a larger campaign.

92621.name: The Golden Banner (4E)
92621.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Grufus Tinker is hosting a feast to honor his rediscovery of the Golden Banner, a holy relic key to the history of Greenport. On the day of the feast, word comes to Tinker that somebody plans to attack his celebration. Now Tinker needs a few heroes to investigate the attack and protect his guests. As the characters investigate they peel back layers of intrigue, and discover a centuries old conflict between faiths.

The Golden Banner is a short Forth-Edition adventure for five characters level 6-8. It is set in an urban port city that can easily be placed in any setting or run as a one-shot.

92622.name: Bloodlines: New Options for Sorcerers
92622.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The sorcerer bloodlines in the Pathfinder RPG rulebook allow great variety within a single class. Yet, the bloodlines only hint at the differences that might exist among sorcerers. Not all undead are the same. Good and evil outsiders range beyond devils and angels. Some aberrations display a variety of powers that include abilities not all similar to those in the core rulebook.

This supplement, written by Stefen Styrsky, allows players to create a sorcerer based on a bloodline derived from a specific creature such as a naga or efreeti, rather than a general celestial, infernal, abyssal or aberrant heritage. Two monstrous humanoid bloodlines, doppelganger and medusa, and a treant bloodline are also included. A total of 13 new sorcerous bloodlines are featured, along with four new Feats useful to any sorcerer character.

92623.description:
From the back of the book:

THE FUTURE OF WARFARE IS HERE!

Welcome to the 31st century, a time of endless wars that rage across the known universe. These epic conflicts are won and lost by BattleMechs, 30-foot-tall, humanoid titans of metal bristling with high-intensity lasers, rapid-fire autocannon and dozens of other lethal weapons; enough firepower to level entire city blocks. Your elite force of MechWarriors drive these juggernauts into battle, blasting at your opponent's 'Mechs in a deadly game of kill or be killed. Will they become instant legends, or forgotten casualties? Only your skill and luck will determine their fate.

Drawing on years of experience, this book combines the best of the BattleTech board game into a unified whole. BattleTech Master Rules is entirely restructured and streamlined; it is the same game, but like you've never seen it before. This book includes the complete game rules, a quick-and-easy scenario creation system, the Battle Value point system for evaluating 'Mechs and balancing forces, and revised and expanded miniatures rules.

User comment:

This was the default, complete ruleset for BattleTech at the time of printing, superceding the earlier BattleTech Compendium: Rules of Warfare. Again, no rules were included for AeroTech or BattleSpace units; this ruleset was dedicated to ground-based combat.

These rules were revised and re-issued several times. The original FASA edition was published in 1998, and was then substantially updated and re-issued as the FASA Revised edition in 2001, one of the last BattleTech sourcebooks produced by FASA.

In 2002, the BattleTech license was taken over by FanPro, and in 2003 they revised the Master Rules and reossued them as the Classic BattleTech Master Rules, Revised in a softback format, followed by a hardback edition in 2004.

The BattleTech: Master Rules were finally superceded when Fanpro released the first edition of Classic BattleTech: Total Warfare in 2006.
92623.name: BattleTech: Master Rules

92624.description:
From the back of the book:

THE STAR LEAGUE STRIKES BACK!

The brave warriors of Task Force Serpent secretly made the thousand-light-year journey to the Smoke Jaguar home world of Huntress to eliminate the last of the Clan's holdings. What they find there will test the limits of their skills, their endurance and their loyalty.

Twilight of the Clans is a BattleTech scenario pack that picks up where the Dragon Roars left off, as the campign to end the Clan invasion reaches its stunning climax! Players can take the part of the Star League or the defending Clans in a series of ten BattleTech scenarios, and even accept the challenge of commanding the entire assault on Huntress in a detailed BattleForce 2 campaign.

User comment:

This BattleTech scenario pack forms the second volume in the series charting the end of the war between the Clans and the Inner Sphere, and follows on from the earlier BattleTech scenario "The Dragon Roars." While this scenario pack doesn't add any new rules or equipment, it does incorporate a wide range of units including ProtoMechs and OmniFighters, and includes detail on BattleForce 2 campaigns, a relative rarity in BattleTech scenarios.

Although this scenario pack is now out of print, it's available as an electronic download from the current license holder.
92624.name: BattleTech: Twilight Of The Clans

92625.name: Monopoly: Fulham FC Edition
92625.description:
Version of Monopoly which replaces the traditional properties with players from Fulham FC past and present.

From the publisher's website:
A must for all Fulham fans, this new edition of Monopoly features current stars alongside the legends of the past, and is your chance to find out just who is the hottest property at the club!

Put together your own dream team by buying and selling players as you try to bankrupt your opponents.

Now's your chance to snap up the likes of Andy Johnson, Johnny Haynes, Alan Mullery, George Cohen and even Mohamed Al Fayed himself, as well as the famous stands of Craven Cottage as you race round the board and to victory!

92626.name: Spin the Black Circle
92626.description:
User Summary

A physics game, you rotate the room trying to move a ball from the starting position to the goal. Simple controls to spin the room left or right, many levels require a fair amount of finesse.

92627.name: GameMaster Publications (Issue 1 - Oct 1985)
92627.description:
User summary

FEATURE SCENARIO:

A Flight of Eagles: A complete 31-page adventure for 4-7 characters of levels 4-7.

A routine recovery job, bread and butter work for any party of self-respecting adventurers. What could go wrong?
A few bugbears aren't going to cause any difficulty, are they?
Background information for the Zhalindor and Pelinore campaigns are presented on pages 42 and 43.

OTHER FEATURES:

Elemental Magic in AD&D
Pelinore Campaign World
- Masterion
- It's a Living
- The Ranger Battalion

The Hive Brood: A Brief Encounter - and a nasty new opponent

News, Letters, VOP and Reviews

rpg.2273: Slaine: The Roleplaying Game of Celtic Heroes

92628.name: Tir Nan Og: The Land of the Young
92628.description:
From the back of the book:

The Land of the Young

Tir Nan Og is the legendary Celtic Land of the Young, a world rather like a legendary version of Northern Europe in a time before much of that continent sank beneath the waves. The four Tribes of the Earth Goddess, on whom the Sláine stories concentrate, are threatened on all sides, with the constant risk of the Fomorians sweeping down from the icy north, the Drune Lords encroaching from the south and the ravages of the berserkers of Midgard in the east.

Tir Nan Og is a land full of heroes, and full of great quests for those heroes to do. This supplement aims to provide all you need to know to wander the Land of the Young for decades, whether as a mercenary or cattle-rustler, thief or adventurer, tribal emissary or war-band leader. All the major regions of Tir Nan Og are covered, particularly places of interest and general geography.

Inside You Will Find:

The Sessair: The tribe that stands up. These people consider themselves the strongest, the fiercest and most valiant of the four tribes.

The Finians: The tribe that endures. Both proud and stubborn, Finians do not budge when their beliefs and customs are attacked.

The Fir Domain: The tribe of the growling shields. The Fir Domain have a reputation for civility and sophistication. Their wisdom is not only found in their counsel. The Fir Domain fight using that most unlikely of Celtic weapons - a plan.

The Falians: The tribe of the shadows. Few things can unite the Sessair, Finians and Fir Domain in a unanimous opinion, but the Tribe of the Shadows, or Falians, is definitely one of them.

Dinas Emrys and the Cambrian Mountains: Dinas Emrys is known as the Eternal Fortress, because it has always been atop Snowdon and always will be.

The Gaesatae: Information on the gaesatae, the bands of Goddess-worshipping elite mercenaries who wander Tir Nan Og.

Lands of the Drune Lords: Detailing the lands of the enemy, the sourlands and forbidding country of the Drune Lords where they plot to bring about Ragnarok.

The Borderlands: The lands that lie between the Tuatha de Danann and the Drunes are predominantly occupied by two of the world's oldest civilisations, the Titans and the Fir Bolg.

Midgard: Wedged between icy seas, towering mountains and the domains of the earth goddess tribes sits Midgard, the land of the Norse tribes that are the children of Voden.

Scenario Hooks: Scenario hooks and ideas to be used as is, or adapted to your own campaign to help bring the Land of the Young to life.

Encounters in Tir Nan Og: Random encounters particular to Tir Nan Og, certain to liven up any long journey.

Requires the use of Dungeons & Dragons Player's Handbook, Third Edition, published by Wizards of the Coast

92629.name: Abducted by Aliens
92629.description:
Escape from an alien spaceship by overcoming obstacles and helping the visitors to learn more about the planet Earth.

Movement on the map can only be done between adjacent spaces. Every space you land on has a play card that reveals quests, grant items, or pose challenges, such as finding a key, competing with another player, drawing a picture, acting out a pantomime or really anything. The outcome of any performance or challenge is decided by one of the othere players or by voting with special cards. Try to pass it as many times as you wish or just find your way around.

The goal of the game is to be first to the finish square after opening a certain number of play cards.

The game is very engaging and requires some logic and strategic skills.

92630.name: Breakout! (Issue 31 - Jul 1988)
92630.description:
User Summary

Table of Contents

Editorial
What's New by Grant Garraway
PBM News by Adrian Pett
Decisive Battles of American Civil War Vol. 2 by Nigel Slater
Albedo Anthropomorphics by Paul Kidd
7th Fleet by Nigel Brand
PBM Galactic Warlord by Peter Read
Panzer Strike by Nigel Slater
Reach for the Stars 3rd Ed by Terry Mack
BATTETECH Module: Origins of Express by Kevin O'Neil
Snapshot by Nigel Slater
MERP Gondor Modules Review by Andrew Brew
The Battle of Kiev by Jack Radey
At First Glance by Nigel Slater
Letters
Lines of Communication by Adrian Pett
Convention News
Marketplace

92631.name: Mr. Potato Head Saves Veggie Valley
92631.description:
Mr. Potato Head Saves Veggie Valley is a CD-Rom game for Windows. Mr. Potato Head, along with Sweet Potato, must go get a rain cloud from the fair to water the baby spuds and end the drought.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mr. Potato Head Saves Veggie Valley", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

92632.name: The IN Game
92632.description: The IN Game or Initials Game is a game in which you make your way around a board and as you go, you are challenged to figure out famous athletes, politicians, entertainers, and other influential historical figures. You are given their initials, one clue, and 30 seconds. For example: GW and "The father of our country." The answer is George Washington. WS and 'He bought Alaska." The answer is William Seward. Land on a BETS space, and opponents can place bets (double or nothing) on whether or not you can answer a clue in a tough category. The IN Game includes 1,200 different clues. This game can be played with 2-6 individual players or in teams.

92633.name: Homage & Fealty
92633.description:
Homage & Fealty is a card game for 2-6 players where you bid resources (your treasury) to woo population into your kingdom in order to enrich it. The more people you have, the more attractive it'll become and the more resources you'll have in order to woo more population.

You'll need the custom deck, 10 cubes in 6 different colors, poker chips that can handle at least 3 different denominations, and about 30-45 minutes of time.

Each card represents a person such as a farmer, potter, candlestick maker, etc. that have a certain cost to get them to move to your kingdom and declare their fealty to your crown. Each provides victory points which allows you to win the game. The player with the highest VP total wins.

Originally entered in Quick Print and Play Design Challenge - General Discussion Thread

92634.name: The Dream Machine

videogamehonor.32112: 2011 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee

92634.description:
The Dream Machine is a browser-based point'n'click adventure game made out of clay and cardboard.

You play as Victor and Alicia, a couple who've just moved into a new apartment. While trying to get settled in, they soon discover that all is not as it seems in the quiet, unassuming apartment building...

Source: The Game Website.

92635.name: The Last Airbender
92635.description:
User Summary

The Last Airbender is an action-adventure title based on the movie by the same name. Players experience the story from the perspective of Prince Zuko as he tracks the Avatar in an effort to regain his honour.

Playcrs control three different characters – Zuko, Aang, and the Blue Spirit – in different stages. There are a number of enemies that can be dispatched using a combination of melee combos and bending techniques. The Wii releases make use of the motion control to perform advanced attacks.

92636.name: Avatar: The Last Airbender – The Path of Zuko
92636.description:
User Summary

Avatar: The Last Airbender – The Path of Zuko is an action-adventure title based on the television series Avatar: The Last Airbender. The game follows Zuko through some events in the third season of the show.

The game plays similarly to older Zelda titles – players travel the map solving puzzles, finding keys, and defeating enemies. Many of the puzzles make use of Zuko’s firebending abilities, and combat involves players shooting fire at the enemies.

92637.name: Avatar: Legends of the Arena
92637.description:
User Summary

Avatar: Legends of the Arena is an MMO title available for download on the Nickelodeon website. The game is based before the events of the Avatar: The Last Airbender television series.

Players are able to create their own characters in the Avatar world, choosing from one of the four bending elements. Once a player has created their character, they can battle with other players in 3D arenas. Winning battles earns loot and equipment, and as a character gains experience they will unlock more powerful techniques.

92638.name: Mega Man Battle & Chase

videogamefranchise.6399: The Best (Best Selling PlayStation Games, JP)

92638.description:
User Summary

Mega Man Battle & Chase is a kart racing game similar to Mario Kart. The game features Mega Man and several characters – both friend and foe – from his games.

Players choose a racer who starts with a thematic vehicle. The kart is broken into four parts – body, engine, wing, and tire – which can be replaced. Each race pits the player against another Robot Master, and if they win, they will earn parts of the loser’s kart that can be used to customize their racer. Each part provides a unique ability or advantage.

The body piece is what determines which weapons are available to each player. Each body part is equipped with a standard and charge weapon. Players can also play against a friend in two player races. The game was rereleased as part of the Mega Man X collection.

92639.name: Icedale Freeholds
92639.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Bound by the deadly Frozen Forest, the impassable Sunken Realm, and the treacherous Frozen Sea, the Freeholds are the most isolated and remote realm on the continent. Beset by undead and Hellfrost horrors, the rugged settlers and hardy nomads who call this realm home are slaves to no man, for here all are considered equal.

92640.name: Heldalund
92640.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Heldalund is a demoralized nation. Orcs control the northern reaches and the second largest town, Hellfrost dragons circle in the west, the army has withered to a shadow of its former self, and trade has been crippled by a loss of exports and high taxation in Cul. Heldalund stands on the brink of disaster, but all is not yet lost.

92641.description:
Scenarios for Advanced Squad Leader. Scenarios in this pack include:

FE 50 Hungarian Action: Hungarian paratroopers drop into action! Yes, I said Hungarian Paratroopers!! This battle is the one fight where the Hungarian paratroopers actually did a combat drop. Ok this is not 100% historically accurate, the landing was unopposed and the Hungarians marched into battle but still somewhat captures the action of a bridge capture. Uses boards 23 and 49 and is medium sized.

FE 51 Wolf Pack in the Hills: Many of you have been clamoring for a good ambush scenario. Ok maybe one of you, but here is a cool situation. An Italian convoy moves across the board 50 hill and runs into a Partisan ambush. Partisans basically have to annihilate the convoy, while the Italians basically have to survive.

FE 52 With Friends Like These: Set on boards 32 and 50 this scenario features the Italians (actually Albanians serving for Italy) fighting the Bulgarians. A nice tourney sized scenario the Italians have to capture some buildings from the defending Bulgarians.

FE 53 Operation Braun: This is the meatiest of the bunch with a large Partisan force defending against Croatian troops backed up by some armor. Set on boards 41 and 50, the Croatians have to capture some buildings. Tough to accomplish against stone buildings.

FE 54 Dubrovnik 2: This is an interesting one set on board 48. Attacking Croatian troops have to kick out a small Partisan force from the village. Then they have defend against a counterattacking force. The victory conditions are tied around holding buildings, with fortified buildings (which can be made during play) counting for more VP. A smaller sized scenario that should allow for some good replay.

FE 55 Friends No More: Here is cool scenario set on boards 4, 8 and FE1 (free for download from my website, for use with VASL). Germans and Rumanians try to control a bridge with the Germans having to get some VP over the bridge. Again, another smaller tourney sized scenario.

FE 56 Covering the Retreat: This is a medium sized scenario set on boards w and 18. Defending Germans get some armor including French tanks and have to defend against a tidal wave, well a small wave of Russian combined arms. Germans try to hold onto a building or 3.

FE 57 War Without End: Defending Germans with some Italian tanks and assault guns defend the board 12 village from very powerful British armored troops crossing the board 50 hill mass. The Germans who are very brittle try to keep a hold of a building or two while the Brits race against time.

FE 58 The End is in Sight: A medium sized scenario featuring Croatian infantry and armor trying to break through a Partisan blocking force. Set on boards 10 and 44. This is another one of those scenarios featuring vehicles from Armies of Oblivion; another example of the vast amount of scenarios that can now be played with ASL.

FE 59 But We’re Not Quite There!: Once again a tired Croatian armor and infantry force, this time smaller due to previous battles tries to blast through a Partisan blocking force. This is another tourney-sized scenario set on board 45.
92641.name: Balkan Warfare Pack: ASL

92642.description:
Duelers is an action figure based collectible game where players amass exciting armies to battle their friends. Duelers miniatures stand two to three inches tall and represent a vast variety of genres and archetypes. Duelers are meant to be easy to pickup and play. Players can choose to play with two duelers or twenty; there is no minimum or maximum army counnt. Like other miniatures games systems, Duelers is based on 6-sided dice to randomize combat. However, in addition to dice, Duelers utilizes "combat cards" to add an extra level of strategy to the game. Attack Cards can give you an extra edge in battle, and Defense Cards will cause your opponent's carefully laid plans of men (and mice) to go awry.

In addition to total enemy annihilation, players are vying for special game objectives in the form of Treasure Chests. Successfully defending your own chests is good, but capturing your opponent's chests is what separates the winners and the losers. Gameplay proceeds as players alternate turns until one of three things happens. Either all of the Treasure Chests are captured, or all of a player’s Duelers are slain, or there’s an earthquake that shakes the pieces onto the floor.
92642.name: Duelers

boardgamehonor.13895: 2011 Golden Geek Best Abstract Board Game Nominee

92643.description:
In Artus, the round table of legend is a turntable in the center of the game board with a space marked with a crown for the king, numbers on the edge from +10 to -15 counter-clockwise from the king, and a few spaces worth 0.

Each player has six cards in hand – two knight cards, two royalty cards, and two scoring cards – and plays two cards each turn. By doing this, players are able to place figures of their color or neutral figures around the table, score certain areas or figures under certain circumstances, and place rings on neutral figures or to move them. The neutral figure bearing three rings is the current king, and the table is always oriented to place this figure in the crown location. A new king can come into power though, which will find everyone sitting in a new location.

The player with the most points after eleven rounds wins the game. Artus has two sets of rules: basic rules for families and casual gamers and "professional rules" for more experienced gamers.
92643.name: Artus

92644.description:
In the cooperative deduction game Schnappt Hubi!, which uses an electronic device similar to the one in Wer war's?, the players explore an old house by building a 3D-labyrinth of "broken" walls in the first phase and chasing a ghost in the second.

Each player starts with his figure – a red or yellow mouse or blue or green hare – in one predetermined corner of the square house, which features a 4x4 grid of rooms that lacks any walls at the start of the game. The players find out which kind of walls are in certain directions by pressing one of four "arrow buttons" of a "compass" device with a built-in AI (to ensure that each game will have a different house). Walls come in four types: One that allows all animals to pass through, one with a mousehole that allows only mice through, one with a hole in the top that only hares can jump through, and one that's solid and impassable. The players build those walls, creating step-by-step a 3D-labyrinth. The goal of this first phase is to find the "magic doors", which can be opened only if there is an animal on each side.

Once the players find the magic doors, the ghost "Hubi" appears. The device gives hints to the players, allowing them to deduce where Hubi is so that ideally they can eventually chase it out of the house.

Schnappt Hubi! includes three difficulty levels, with a "timer" running in the hardest level that ends the game after a certain number of moves.
92644.name: Schnappt Hubi!

92645.name: Agatha Christie: The A.B.C. Murders (2009)
92645.description:
Agatha Christie's The A.B.C. Murders has players control Captain Hastings and must solve the mystery by inspecting crime scenes and questioning suspects. In order to appeal to players familiar with the original story, the game also offers the option to play with a different murderer, which results in different clues and testimony throughout the entire game. The game received mediocre reviews, but was commended for its faithful recreation of the source material.

Source: Wikipedia, "The A.B.C. Murders", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

User Summary:

In this DS game, the player searches for a murderer, asking questions of eyewitnesses and answering riddles. Word answers are written using the DS touchscreen which appears as an old fashioned notepad.

92646.name: The Million Pound Drop
92646.description:
Based on the TV show of the same name that challenges the public to bet big or risk losing everything.

Just like the TV show you begin with a million pounds in your possession, bundled as sets of £50 notes. Over a series of rounds you then run the risk of losing some or the entire amount. The game continues until you complete all the questions, or are left with nothing. How do you win or lose money? Well you must answer questions correctly, with a sequence of multiple choice questions consisting or four, three and then two possible answers.
That’s where the fun starts. The board game consists of four trap doors that you can place money on to pick your answers. You can put money on as many doors as you like, but must leave one empty. There’s only ever one right answer, so if you spread money across multiple doors you will always lose some of it (or all if the empty door is the correct one).

92647.name: Speed Dating
92647.description:
In Speed Dating everybody gets a new personality consisting of a name, age, job and five hobbies out of six categories (travelling, culture, sports, leisure time, esoterism and nerd stuff). You have 45 seconds to interview each of the other players.

Remember their traits, find the one who fits best, and live happily ever after.

92648.name: GameMaster Publications (Issue 2 - Dec 1985)
92648.description:
User summary

Loose cover which had maps for the scenario printed on the inside cover.

FEATURE SCENARIO:

Find the Lady: A complete 32-page adventure for characters of levels 1-3.

Finding missing people is a job any adventurers for hire get used to. But when the missing person turns out to be the recently deceased wife of a prominent merchant's son, and when there is the small matter of a major jewelry theft to deal with as well, then you've got an adventure that is nothing other than normal....
Background information for the Pelinore and Zhalindor campaigns are presented on pages 45 and 46.
Inside front and back covers have maps for this adventure

OTHER FEATURES:

Secondary Skills: Tinker, Tailor, Soldier....
Pelinore Campaign World
- The Night Life of the City League
- The Order of the Blue Light
- It's a Living

Dunerigger: A Brief Encounter - introducing new role-playing ideas

News, Letters, VOP and Reviews

92649.name: GameMaster Publications (Issue 3 - Mar 1986)

rpgissueversion.84878: GM3 - In Search of New Gods

92649.description:
User summary

FEATURE SCENARIO:

In Search of New Gods: A complete 32-page adventure for up to 8 characters of levels 4-7.

You've earned quite a reputation as fearless adventurers, the sort who take on anything. But what happens when you come face-to-face with the challenge that bested the greatest adventurer in the whole Kingdom? Can you succeed where Feyr-Panniras failed? Can you find what has turned his friends against the Kingdom? And, more than anything, can you survive against the power of the New Gods?
Background information for the Pelinore and Zhalindor campaigns are presented on pages 47 and 48.
Inside front cover has a map for this adventure

OTHER FEATURES:

Defenders of the Faith: Cleric and religion in the D&D Games
Pelinore Campaign World
- The County of Cerwyn: Tirhalter

The Moment of Truth: A Brief Encounter - introducing new role-playing ideas

News, Letters, VOP and Reviews

92650.name: Midian: Dark Fantasy Role-playing Game
92650.description:
From the Introduction:

Midian is the flagship product of Lost Souls Publishing. This is a dark fantasy noir game (with bits of science fiction added in for good measure) which means that the game has warriors charging in on horseback, necromancy, and strange beasts. As Midian is in the Dark Fantasy genre, the game focuses less on slaying monsters in caves, saving princessess, and amassing obscene amounts of power and wealth, but rather it focuses more on personal struggles, man's inhumanity to man, grey morality, personal horror, and the other less pretty aspects of life.

Playing Midian requires no dowloads or purchases. It is a table-top roleplaying game, meaning you and your friends play this together with pencils & dice, rather than using cards or a board, or in front of a computer. Midian was created for face-to-face gaming, but you can play online on the forums, or using a third-party client.

92651.name: GameMaster Publications (Issue 4 - Jun 1986)
92651.description:
User summary

FEATURE SCENARIO:

The Awakening: A complete 32-page adventure for 4-6 characters of levels 7-8.

Stupid dwarves. You visit their delve, and they announce that they are all off to belt the living daylights out of some troublesome goblins. And can you go along? No chance, it's some sort of 'crusade', and they don't want outsiders along. So, all they are prepared to offer you is the honour of defending all the old dwarves and the kiddies and the others who haven't gone off on the goblin-bash. So, it looks like you'll just have to sit around and drink all the beer and be bored until they...
Wait - what's this? A raid on a neighbouring delve; that's a stroke of luck. Now you can chase the raiders, beat themup, and then the dwarves will be grateful and you can drink some more of their beer. What could be simpler?
Background information for the Pelinore campaign is presented on page 48.
Inside front cover has a map for this adventure

OTHER FEATURES:

Race Relations: Non-human races in D&D and AD&D
Pelinore Campaign World
- The City League: The Old Wharf

Red Swords: A Brief Encounter for Oriental Adventures

Letters, News, and Reviews

92652.name: GameMaster Publications (Issue 5 - Feb 1987)
92652.description:
User summary

This is the last issue of GMPubs.

FEATURE SCENARIO:

The Rod of Serraillian: A complete 40-page adventure for 6-9 characters of levels 6-8.

Travelling long distances is the constant lot of the adventurer. This time, their quest will take them across the sea, and deep into the interior of a country they know little about, to retrieve an artifact stolen by one bunch of clerics from another. Now, we all know that meddling in the affairs of the Gods can be a hazardous affair, but this time the Gods haven't been worshipped for hundreds of years, and their clerics slaughtered each other in a great battle back in the distant past. Maybe this is that adventure we've all been waiting for, where the treasure is just sort of sitting there, and all we have to do is go and get it...
Background information for the Pelinore campaign is presented on page 55.
Inside front and back covers have maps for this adventure

OTHER FEATURES:

Reaching A Certain Level: It's a long way to the top
Pelinore Campaign World
- The City League: Questions & Answers

News, and Reviews

92653.name: Condition Cards
92653.description:
From the Paizo Publishing website:

With Condition Cards, it’s easy for players and GMs to keep track of the Pathfinder RPG’s most common conditions. Did the bard fascinate your party? Is your wizard invisible? Is the fighter bleeding out? Simply hand out the appropriate condition cards to have all the rules for each condition at your fingertips. This set of 52 hilariously illustrated, full-color cards allows you to play faster and more easily than ever before.

There are 4 copies each of 13 different cards, with different (but related) conditions on each side:

* blinded/deafened
* dazed/stunned
* exhausted/fatigued
* grappled/pinned
* shaken/frightened
* sickened/nauseated
* staggered/paralyzed
* helpless/flat-footed
* dazzled/fascinated
* confused/entangled
* bleed/dying
* prone/unconscious
* incorporeal/invisible

Also included is a new spell, soothing word.

92654.name: 1879: A sangre y fuego en las costas de los Andes
92654.description:
1879: A sangre y fuego is a wargame covering the main campaigns of the War of the Pacific: the campaigns of Antofagasta, Tarapá and Tacna, as well as the maritime operations involved. One player leads the Chilean army, while the other leads the Peruvian and Bolivian troops. The map represents the zone of the conflict, between Arequipa and the desert of Atacama.

It is a typical wargame with the system "I go - you go", in which victory is obtained by means of control of geographical objectives. The rules take into account supply and lines of communication.

92655.name: Kryształy Czasu (Magia i Miecz edition)
92655.description:
user summary

This is original version of Kryształy Czasu, originally published in Magia i Miecz magazine (first 25 issues) + additional rules in later issues put on website with (possibly) additional, later additions.
The first part of the content was published in 1993 in first issue of Magia i Miecz.

This version differs greatly from the later book version.

92656.name: Mi Gato se Incendia!
92656.description:
Mi Gato se Incendia! (My Cat is on Fire!) A board game of escaped housecats and strange situations.In Mi Gato se Incendia! 2-6 players take the part of a family chasing after their escaped house cat.Mi Gato has slipped its bonds and is running free through the neighborhood. But with freedom, comes a price.

Fire.

Rogue Russian satellites, BBQ grills, street punks - and much more can cause Mi Gato to burst into a fiery ball of spite. Mi Gato has 9 lives and it's up to the players to capture it and return it safely home, or no one wins!

Use two decks of cards - one to move Mi Gato, the other to call in the vet, put a smoldering cat out, capture Mi Gato, and foil each others plans!

Mi Gato se Incendia is an electronic publication, available as PDFs and comes with everything you'll need to play this game. The game board can be printed out on a single piece of 8.5" x 11" paper. All cards will fit on standard Avery Business Card templates, or can be printed on plain paper.

92657.name: GURPS Espada da Galáxia
92657.description:
Translated from the Introduction

GURPS Espada da Galáxia tries to be a middle ground between hard sci-fi and Fantasy sci-fi. Yes, we have aliens denser than steel, but only because there is no water on their bodies - only pure metal. Yes, we have alive robots, but they are in fact intelligent crustaceans that have substituted their shells for mechanical bodies. Yes,we have swords of indestructible metal, but that's because they are made of metallic hydrogen - an hypothetical material that would be the densest known substance, found on the nucleus of Jupiter and Saturn.

User Summary

GURPS Espada da Galáxia is a web published supplement based on the novel Espada da Galáxia by Marcelo Cassaro, it was released for free on the website by the author after a long series of problems with the publisher.

92658.name: House2House
92658.description:
The goal of this game is to become familiar with selected scriptures found in Bible Topics for Discussion.

In his turn Publisher (player) should choose one of his Scriptural Questions cards while keeping it hidden from every player in the game and ask the next player in clockwise order the scriptural question.
The responding Publisher can answer the question directly or may request for a Hint.

Publisher may be awarded the score at the top right corner of the Scriptural Questions card, or the score at the bottom left corner of the Scriptural Questions card if a fair knowledge of the scripture is established.
Whenever a responding Publisher fails to get the answer correctly (with/without the hint) within the period of the sand timer, the asking Publisher should read out the correct answer to the rest of the Publishers in the game and then move his Pawn according to the number appearing on the bottom left corner of the Scriptural Questions card in the direction of the arrow on the board.
Winner is the players with the most points.

92659.name: Iron Heroes Counter Collection
92659.description:
From publisher blurb:

This counter collection brings to you every monster in the Iron Heroes Bestiary - including a multi-page multi-level Colossus of Thard!

Also included are counters for each class in the Iron Heroes Revised Core Book as well as multiple representations of the 3 new character classes found in the Iron Heroes Player's Companion.

Add some excitement to your gaming table with this Iron Heroes specific counter collection!

92660.name: Glacier Keep
92660.description:
From publisher blurb:

Glacier Keep was the home of the Master Imbrund: a magical ice fortress that could endure the hottest summers and the fiercest siege. One hundred years ago, it vanished as suddenly as the Masters themselves. Yesterday, it returned.

The Iron Heroes Gencon 2007 Adventure Glacier Keep by Adam Windsor contains the adventure itself, six pre-generated PCs of 4th level, three new monsters, one new template, and notes for adapting Glacier Keep for use in your home campaign.

92661.name: O Jogo da Enciclopédia
92661.description: One player (the leader of the round) take a card from a pile containing weird questions (such as "why chicken lay eggs of different colors"), then he chooses one of them and reads it aloud for the rest of the players. Each one of the players must write secretly an answer for the question. More than knowing the correct answer, it is important to try and convince your opponents that your answer is the right one. After all players have written their papers, the leader reads aloud all of the answers given by the players adding the correct answer from the card. Then each player vote on the definition he thinks is the correct. Players score by getting votes from others players, by giving the correct answer to the question or by voting in the correct answer. The leader of the round only scores if no player votes in the correct answer.

92662.name: Jack of All Sides
92662.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jack of All Sides is a d20 adventure, playing in the world of the Iron Kingdoms designed for three to four characters of levels 2-4.

The 7th isn’t what you would call ‘Cygnar’s Finest’. Much of their ill-fated reputation was brought to them by Captain Gerald Custler. Although Captain Custler was a smart and educated man, he behaved quite jumpy in the field, ordering often disastrous manoeuvres and getting many loyal Cygnarans killed.
A week ago, during a border skirmish with Khadoran troops, he led his men into an awkward position where they got caught between friendly and enemy fire.
Much of the 7th was slaughtered that day...
What remains of the division has been sent to the second line of defence for a much needed rest.

92663.name: The Raid on Rannigh's Cliff
92663.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Raid on Rannigh's Cliff is a d20 adventure, playing in theworld of the Iron Kingdoms designed for three to four characters of levels 1-3. It introduces the players to Rannigh’s Cliff Fortress, one of the hundreds of fortresses covering the west coast of Cygnar that were built to protect the kingdom from the threat of Cryx.

92664.name: The Steam Spire
92664.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Orgoth never got within an Argus’ yell of the Fingers. Between the Ordic navy and the cliffs, the city was never in any danger. Simple minded folk tell tales about flying monsters, Orgoth fireballs exploding in the streets, and things coming up through the ground – but if that was true why aren’t we all speaking Orgoth now? Eh?

This three-part adventure for character levels 7-9 revolves around Katrina Craslovini’s adventure in the tunnels and caves that link two of the islands in the Five Fingers.

The trilogy appeared originally on the Privateer Press forums.

92665.name: The Hidden City
92665.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Hidden City is a d20 adventure, taking place two years after the events of the The Witchfire Trilogy. It has been designed for four to five characters of levels 8-9.

Following trains of human slaves Harven soon tracks down the Skorne to the Rotterhorn Mountain where he finds a large citadel. It seems the Skorne have been here for some time.

92666.description:
It is a momentous time for the Post-Human Assembly. Having fully populated the Milky Way Galaxy, the Great Houses turn their eyes towards a neighboring galaxy – endeavoring to venture across the inter-galactic void to stake claim among uncharted stars. Each Great House seeks to dominate this new galaxy, for in the race to achieve hegemony, only one can be victorious.

Hegemonic is a fast-paced game of galactic expansion, empire-building, conflict, and intrigue. As the leader of a Great House, you must expand your control over the sectors of the galaxy, build up your industrial, political, and martial capability, develop awe-inspiring technologies, and carefully time your actions to outmaneuver the other empires.

Deep Strategy
The players are in control, shaping the unexplored galaxy to support their strategic plans instead of having choices dictated by chance.

Rich Tactics
Card-driven conflict mechanics and technology development focus on tough, tactical choices and timing, minimizing luck-based gameplay.

Multilateral Conflict
A player’s industrial, political, and martial systems can all be used offensively and to control regions of the galaxy.

The stars await: can you lead your Great House to victory?
92666.name: Hegemonic

92667.name: Ad Intra Mare II
92667.description:
user summary

Official supplements and aventures for Aquelarre 2nd edition, Volume 2

Suplemento oficial para Aquelarre, el juego de rol demoníaco medieval, volumen 2

Índice:
Ad Intra Mare 10ª parte
Ad Intra Mare 11ª parte
Ad Intra Mare 12ª parte
Ad Intra Mare 13ª parte
PNJ Principales
Fe de erratas

92668.name: Quad D.I.V.A.S.
92668.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sorry I’m late. We used to have an already fine selection from all over Cygnar and beyond, but lately, the strangest stallholders have been pouring in. I just spent 2 hours in the market square, comparing prices for cabbages and lettuces.

Well really? And when did shoes become vegetables, too?

The center of Corvis houses the famous Quad, a large market square, open day and night, where everything not too hot or heavy can be found. A myriad of stalls form a labyrinth for the squiggling mass of shoppers and tourists, all trying to get their share of the cut-price merchandise. Street-traders, hawkers and barrow-boys stroll around in between the different stands, offering even better deals from less reliable sources.
And although the City Watch keeps a close eye on the trades and wares, once after dark many less-than-legal items can be seen changing hands underneath the counter, in the shadows.

In a doomed effort to bring order to the chaos the Quad offers, the good folks of the Buccaneer Bass started a Descriptive Index of Vendors And Stalls (Divas) , partly to avoid the hassle of having to search for items on offer (and the best prices to be had), partly to offer that extra bit of service to our clientele, that’s been dropping in to inform on these matters more and more lately.

92669.name: The Silver Box
92669.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Silver Box is a d20 adventure, playing in the world of the Iron Kingdoms designed for four to six characters of levels 4-5.

With Khadoran forces entrenched within the once proud nation of Llael and Cygnar pressed to defend her own borders, the forces that once policed these proud nations have all but disappeared. Even in Ord, who has yet to act in the war that is rapidly sweeping Immoren, the roads have become a dangerous place to be caught unprotected. With war nearly on all fronts, the Mercarian League and the Mateu Merchant Houses’ rivalry has reached all new heights. This competition has prompted both parties to secure Letters of Marque from Cygnar, thrusting them into a battle for many of the trade routes used throughout western Immoren. In doing so, both parties have taken to raiding one another’s vessels and have recently discovered a dangerous Cryxian item in the process...

92670.name: Cataus
92670.description:
Cataus is the Catalan version of Donjon by Clinton R. Nixon, with additional rules and new text.
The text of this work is licensed under the Creative Commons recognition.

In Catalan:
Es tracta de la traducció al català del famós Donjon de Clinton R. Nixon, amb noves regles i material addicional!

Recordes aquelles meravelloses sensacions que tingueres el primer cop que vas jugar a rol?
Enyores el que sentires quan jugares amb la caixa vermella?
Cataus és un joc emocionant on rebentes portes, explores bosques masmorres, mates monstres, trobes tresors i salves a tothom.

92671.name: Villain Design Handbook (3.5 Edition)
92671.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 140-page book is the ultimate guide to designing the perfect scoundrel PC or villain NPC, and a must have for any player or Game Master. This book is loaded with new rules material including:

A step-by-step guide to villain design
7 new prestige classes
24 new villainous feats
revised rules for anti-feats
81 new evil spells
vicious new combat options
new monsters and undead templates, detailing the rituals for creating all kinds of intelligent undead




Additionally, this tome includes information on: breaking stereotypes; detailing the villain's motivations, obsessions, goals and schemes; and choosing the villain's alignment (and why good-aligned villains are not only possible, but plausible). Detailed emotional archetypes, suggestions for villains and experience, supernatural villains, familiars and many different types of villainous organizations (including assassins' guilds, black marketers, raiders and more) give the evil PC, or the Game Master, a wide variety of new ideas and role-playing insight.

Furthermore, this supplement provides an abundance of information with which to customize any campaign setting. You can make use of the many features of this book in your Kingdoms of Kalamar campaign or any other campaign world. New information on summoning outer planar creatures, becoming undead, hiring henchmen and lackeys, or building a lair ports easily into any campaign. An abundant source of material of the high quality you've come to expect from Kenzer and Company, this is one product you don't want to miss.

Remember, great heroes need even better villains.

92673.name: From Russia With Love
92673.description:
From Introduction:

The From Russia With Love Adventure Module is designed to be played by up to four players and a Gamesmaster. It presents a challenge to one “00” rank, two Agent rank characters, or a party of four Rookie rank characters. Guidelines for modifying the adventure to suit parties consisting of characters of different ranks are offered in this booklet. This adventure involves the characters in a particularly complex and challenging mission and is best suited to experienced players and gamesmasters. Note: The information contained in this book is for you, the Gamesmaster, only. Players should not read this booklet.

92675.name: Dice Age Elementary Edition
92675.description:
This Game is the french Bonide dice game adapted into a card game. You play with decks of cards. Each deck represents a die, and each card within the deck represents a side of the die. Thus a six sided die is represented by a six cards deck with the same back.
At the beginning of the game, decks and tokens are distributed. Your goal is to get rid of all your tokens.
It's a risk-taking game.

When you choose a deck on your turn, you get rid of tokens, depending on the color of the deck. You can then draw a number or an effect on the game. If you draw a number, it has to be lower than the last number played, or you take all of the pot.

92676.name: Engine Heart
92676.description:
Publisher blurb:

The time of the humans has passed.
All that you were built for is no more.
But you and your kind endure.

Engine Heart is a role-playing game set in the aftermath of human extinction. Players take on the roles of small service robots that have managed to survive and continue functioning. This book includes complete rules for creating robots, as well as blank character record sheets, a four-page example of play, several pre-made robots, and dozens of unique features and defects to further customize your creations. A set of ten-sided dice (not included) is required to play.

92677.name: The Farm
92677.description:
From Introduction:

The Farm has endured its long isolation rather well compared to other enclaves. The agricultural robots were constructed to be durable and easily repaired, and most of them are still in good working order.

The farmhouse itself is long-gone, reduced to ash and a chimney by a fire that the household domestic robots were unable to put out.

The domestics were themselves consumed in the blaze, leaving their outdoor companions to face the years alone.

With the resource demands of the house and its staff gone, the farm was able to return to full productivity, turning out bumper crops of corn year after year. The produce trucks continued to arrive at more erratic intervals, bringing word of the spreading desolation and the dwindling number of stops along their route.
When the trucks stopped arriving altogether, the harvest had nowhere to go.

The robots began dumping the excess corn in a nearby quarry (once its sole remaining excavator was dealt with). They continued with this stopgap solution for years, inadvertently creating the world’s largest compost heap in the process.

When the players’ robots arrive, the farm workers will be overjoyed to finally be able to hand off their bounty, and will immediately attempt to press the newcomers into service carrying the season’s produce: hundreds of tons of corn.

Machines that refuse to cooperate have the privilege of meeting the Thresher.

The player’s robots likely stumble upon the Farm by following the remains of the road.

The players’ robots might also enter from the quarry, as the mountain of corn is visible from a distance. If they find the quarry first it is likely deserted (save for the corpse of the excavator), but they may find some signs of local activity on the trail leading back to the Farm.

The river may provide yet another means of passage, either to the Farm or away from it.

92678.name: Alpha Word Game System
92678.description:
The Alpha Word Game System is a comprehensive word game system made up of three components; a deck of Alpha Playing Cards, a set of Alpha Tiles and a double set of Alpha Dice. All three components are by themselves a game system, so having any one component allows you to play several different games, having all three allows you to play even more games.

The Alpha Word Game System is based on the original deck of Alpha Playing Cards which was released in 1997. There has been a two minor changes made to the Alpha Playing Cards in creating the Alpha Word Game System. The first is the addition of the marked vowels on the semi-wild vowels cards and the second is the addition of the board grid on the backs of the Alpha Playing Cards allowing the cards to be made into game boards for the tiles and dice.

The Alpha Word Game System and its components are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 United States License; so anyone can make their own components for the Alpha Word Game System. There are free PDF files that you can use to make your own set. If you are feeling really creative, you can design your own graphics too. You can make as many copies as you like, and if you are in a entrepreneurial mood, you can sell them. If you have question about the Creative Commons License or would like more information please refer go to creativecommons.org. If you still have questions on how it relates to Alpha write to one of the designers.

rpg.1297: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

92679.name: The Frozen Wave Satsuma
92679.description:
Publisher Blurb

The Frozen Wave Satsuma, an adventure for 6-8 adventurers of levels 3-5, is the seventeenth title in Advanced Adventures, where a group of hardy adventurers explore the cold and windy ocean covered in an ominous fog that threatens to subsume the northern coast.

92680.name: The Royal Cartographers
92680.description:
Publisher's blurb;

The Royal Cartographers is an article for The Dying Earth RPG on how to use The Scaum Valley Gazetteer as one large campaign.

It was published as part of the January 2011 edition of Pelgrane's See Page XX house webzine.

92681.name: Spider-Man (1985)
92681.description:
From the back of the box:

While on your quest, Great interactive graphics allow you to search in different rooms, attack creatures, and journey to different lands in order to solve the different mysteries. In the Spider-Man adventure you must prove to the Chief Examiner that you can utilize the powers of Spider-Man. Your objective is twofold: to unlock the riddle of the Chief Examiner and...to survive!

92683.name: JetFighter II

videogameexpansion.131408: JetFighter II: Operation Lightning Storm – Advanced Mission Disk

92683.description:
User Summary

In JetFighter II, you can pilot various fighter jets in a war against the Latin American Revolutionary Alliance (LARA). The game takes place over California, and even includes the cityscape of San Francisco. Available jets include the F-23, F-14 Tomcat, F/A-18 Hornet and F-16.

92684.name: JetFighter III
92684.description:
User Summary

In JetFighter III, you play as an American pilot stationed aboard an aircraft carrier, and you fly various fighter jets against enemy forces in various countries all around the world. Available jets include the F-22N Raptor, F/A-18 Hornet, and F-14 Tomcat.

92685.name: JetFighter IV: Fortress America
92685.description:
User Summary

It is the year 2012, and Russia, North Korea, and China have allied together to invade America. You play as an American fighter pilot against the invading enemy forces. The game takes place over the West coast of America, and boasts over 40,000 square miles of in-game terrain. Available fighter jets include the F-14 Tomcat, F/A-18 Hornet and F-22 Raptor.

92686.description:
From the back of the book:

In early 3061, Prince Victor Steiner-Davion returned from the Clan homeworlds triumphant—but to an Inner Sphere that was radically different. The entire Ghost Bear population had relocated to the Inner Sphere; the St. Ives Compact was under siege; Katrina Steiner-Davion was sitting on the throne of New Avalon. Even with the overwhelming threat of the Clan invasion defeated, the Inner Sphere is still poised precariously between peace and war. Who will light the spark that will set BattleMechs marching and worlds aflame once more?

Drawing on information from five scenario packs, seven sourcebooks and more than a dozen novels, Shattered Sphere represents the ultimate guide to the people and places of BattleTech, as seen through the eyes of the characters who live there. Offering a brief, comprehensive history of the universe and an in-depth look at events from the Truce of Tukayyid through early 3062, this update is a must for any BattleTech fan. Shattered Sphere also includes detailed maps showing the current state of the Inner Sphere and the Clans.

User comment:

Although Shattered Sphere was released at something of an odd time as it fell halfway through the release schedule of the BattleTech Field Manual series. It provides a general update on the major changes and events affecting the various Houses, Clans and major Periphery powers from the 3050s through to around 3061; the detailed state and border maps are very useful for BattleTech and BattleForce 2 campaigns, and this sourcebook is one of the few to touch on two of the up and coming Periphery powers, the Marian Hegemony and the Circinus Federation.
92686.name: BattleTech: Shattered Sphere

92687.name: JetFighter V: Homeland Protector
92687.description:
User Summary

In JetFighter V, a terrorist cult has invaded Western America, and you, as an American pilot, must combat their mysterious army. The game takes place over California and Nevada, and boasts over 90,000 square miles of in-game terrain. Available fighter jets include the F-16 Fighting Falcon, the F/A-22 Raptor, and the F-35 Joint Strike Fighter.

rpgseries.8869: Wizards of the Coast - Free Adventure Downloads

92688.name: Return to the Temple of the Frog
92688.description:
From publisher website:

The Order of the Frog was led by a man of resource and ambition. High Priest Saint Stephen and four companions appeared out of nowhere and took over the order twenty five years ago. Though Stephen and his companions seemed normal enough (except for the slight greenish cast of their skin), they were quite literally not of this world. They were aliens, members of a scientific expedition that crash landed on this planet some years ago.

Temple of the Frog was first published in the 1975 D&D Supplement II, Blackmoor. It was later republished in 1986 as module DA2, Temple of the Frog. In the original adventure, the PCs were hired to find a missing person (Rissa Aleford, Baroness of the Lakes) and investigate a strange cult based on the worship of frogs.

Return to the Temple of the Frog picks up the adventure decades later. During an adventuring party's assault on the temple over twenty years ago, Saint Stephen escaped the conflict and hid in the swamp until the adventurers departed. Having completed their raid, rescued the prisoner they had come for, and hurriedly looted the temple, the heroes left the area and never looked back.

Saint Stephen entered the temple hoping to salvage anything that he could. The Order of the Frog was done for, all his fellow aliens were slain, and his frog cultists had fled or were put to the sword. He only wanted enough to allow him to flee the swamp and find a new hiding place.

He found more than he had counted on....

92689.name: Enemy Engaged: Apache vs Havoc

videogamehonor.29678: 2001 D.I.C.E. Best Simulation Game of the Year Nominee (Computer)

92689.description:
Enemy Engaged: Apache vs Havoc is a helicopter flight simulator game by Razorworks. It was followed by Enemy Engaged: Comanche vs Hokum, which was interconnectable with Apache vs Havoc. It also has a sequel called Enemy Engaged 2. The game features two fully simulated combat helicopter: the US AH64D Apache Longbow and Russian Mil-28N Havoc B.

Source: Wikipedia, Enemy Engaged: Apache vs Havoc, available under the CC-BY-SA License.

92690.name: Joints & Jivers
92690.description:
From publisher blurb:

Joints & Jivers is a comical skewering of cheap 1970s action movies where kung-fu fighters, disco dancers and new-age nutjobs team up to fight The Man in all his forms. A few six-sided dice are needed to play.

User note: This game is bundled with Modempunk in both electronic and print versions.

92691.description:
From the back of the book:

To maintain their monopoly on the flow of information and technology across the vast reaches of space, the powerful organization known as ComStar waged a hidden war of assassination, sabotage and terrorism for more than two hundred years. Now, the Star League has been resurrected and ComStar will play a pivotal role in its continued survival... or its ultimate downfall.

BattleTech Field Manual: ComStar describes the military doctrine, traditions, tactics and battle histories of ComStar's military division, the Com Guards, and the Word of Blake splinter group. This book also provides complete information on the Free Rasalhague Republic and units of the new Star League, including the Eridani Light Horse and Clan Nova Cat, plus new equipment and 'Mechs unique to ComStar.

User comment:

In common with the rest of the BattleTech Field Manual series, this sourcebook provides an military-focussed overview of the entity on the cover - ComStar, in this case - as well as some new rules, equipment and 'Mechs associated with that fasion.

What makes the ComStar Field Manual unusual in comparison to the House and Clan Field Manuals is that it includes a lot of details on both the second Star League, and a number of entities associated with it, in addition to the Word of Blake schismatics. This allowed FASA to fold in the general updates for the Free Rasalhague Republic along with a couple of famous units associated with the old and new Star League as well as Clan Novacat, which had joined the new Star League. That makes this Field Manual more wide-ranging than the others that had published at the time.

This sourcebook is out of print, and unlike the older BattleTech: ComStar sourcebook, it hasn't been released in an electronic form by the current license holder.
92691.name: BattleTech Field Manual: ComStar

92692.name: Roleplayer Independent (Volume 1, Issue 7 - Jun 1993)
92692.description:
Vol I, No. 7

Cover Artist: Peter Jones

92693.name: Enemy Engaged: RAH-66 Comanche vs. KA-52 Hokum
92693.description:
Enemy Engaged: Comanche vs Hokum is an attack helicopter simulation game. The game was a follow up to Enemy Engaged: Apache vs Havoc, and interconnectable with it. The source code has been released and has since then resulted in a heavily modified game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Enemy Engaged: RAH-66 Comanche vs. KA-52 Hokum", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

92694.name: Modempunk
92694.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Modempunk you take on the roles of underground hackers in a dystopian 1980s that never was. Skate, phreak and get the girl as you fight your way to the top of the BBS. If the teenage-hacker-action-movie genre has a role-playing game, this is it! At least one 12-sided die is needed to play.

User note: This game is bundled with Joints & Jivers in both electronic and print versions.

92695.name: Enemy Engaged 2
92695.description:
Enemy Engaged 2 is the sequel to Enemy Engaged: Comanche vs Hokum. It was released on May 25, 2007. Though the sequel was improved in some ways compared to the first game, it has been highly criticized for its lack of new features. Many improvements were already implemented in the modded version of the first game. Some commentators also felt it was not ready for release considering the large amount of bugs it contained. The biggest improvement can be seen in the graphics of the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Enemy Engaged 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

92696.name: Imagine (Issue 22 - Jan 1985)
92696.description:
Imagine 22
January 1985
Adventure Games Magazine

Cover art, "Earl Aubec", by Rodney Matthews

92697.name: Super Action Football
92697.description:
From the instruction booklet:

Get ready to move out of the grandstand and onto the grid-iron! Coleco's SUPER ACTION Football brings the thrill and excitement of professional football right into your home. A team of highly skilled athletes is at your command from the opening kickoff through the final seconds of play.

Your SUPER ACTION Controller provides an eight-directional Control Stick that allows you to move your backfield men anywhere on the field. A special Speed Roller increases pass distance and runner speed. Best of all, you call every play with the multiple-use buttons on the keypad. Execute each play by skillfully maneuvering your backfield. You do it all in SUPER ACTION Football!

92698.description:
From the back of the book:

Ravaged during the Succession Wars and poorly governed by paranoid Chancellors, the Capellan Confederation has languished at the mercy of its more powerful neighbours for centuries. However, the time of Xin Sheng has arrived. A new birth. The devious and brilliant Sun-Tzu Liao leads his people into a glorious era of national pride and prosperity. Through subterfuge and warfare, he is driven to reclaim everything the Confederation has lost.

BattleTech Field Manual: Capellan Confederation provides an in-depth look at the rising power of House Liao, including profiles on every Confederation regiment and the regiments of the newly conquered St. Ives Compact. Special rules reflecting the unique abilities of each regiment are included, along with new equipment and 'Mechs exclusive to the Capellan Confederation.

User comment:

This sequel to the earlier House Liao (The Capellan Confederation) follows the same format as the other BattleTech Field Manuals in that it focuses largely on the military structure of the Capellan Confederation before introducing a scattering of new equipment, 'Mechs, vehicles, a Warship and some Battle Armour.

While this sourcebook is out of print, it has been released in an electronic format by the new license holder, Catalyst Game Labs, making it much easier to get hold of than some of the other Field Manuals.
92698.name: BattleTech Field Manual: Capellan Confederation

92699.name: Casus Belli (Issue 38 - Jun 1987)
92699.description:
User Summary:

This issue includes:

- Wargame reviews: Tanks Leader, Flight Leader and Dunkirk
- Boardgame review: Capitaine Cosmos, the French edition of
Starship Captain
- RPG reviews: Runequest 3rd edition and Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay
- Scenarios for Runequest, Call of Cthulhu and AD&D
- Scenarios for miniature wargames Les Aigles and La Flèche et l'épée
- a game: Les éperons d'or, a wargame about the battle of Courtrai in 1302
- a monster designed by Philippe Druillet
- an article detailing the lake surrounding Laelith (a Casus Belli setting developed in several issues)
- an article with game mastering tips for the RPG Légendes

As well as the usual columns: wargaming bibliography, book, movies and comic books reviews, news, short game reviews...

92700.name: Destructor
92700.description:
From the instruction booklet:

Your starcruiser lands in the hostile city of Araknid to collect precious Crystals needed desperately on Earth. Your equipment: the mighty Ram-car. Use your Ram-car to bump Krystaloids, transforming them into precious Crystals! But watch out for the evil Destructor and deadly Insektoids, protectors of the Krystaloids! Can you collect the invaluable jewel-like Crystals and fly home?

92701.name: MICROTAN 65
92701.description:
The Tangerine Microtan 65 (sometimes abbreviated M65) was a 6502 based single board microcomputer, first sold in 1979, which could be expanded into, what was for its day, a comprehensive and powerful system. The design became the basis for what later became the ORIC, ATMOS and later computers, which had similar keyboard addressing and tape I/O as in the Microtan 65. The Microtan 65 had a single step function that could be used for debugging at the hardware level. The computer was available as ready-built boards or as kits consisting of board and components requiring soldering together.

The Microtan 65 was intended as a general purpose microcomputer which could be used by laboratories, Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM)s and the computer enthusiast, and it was designed with expandability in mind. In this way the customer could customise the system, be it as a specialised control system, as a learning tool, or as a general purpose computing device.

Price of the Microtan 65 board in 1981 was £79.35 (inc. VAT) in kit form or £90.85 ready-assembled. The system was not generally available in the shops, one of the few stockists at the time being Henry's Radio of Edgware Road, London.

The Microtan 65 was quite simple by today's standards, with:

an NMOS 6502 CPU running at 750 kHz clock rate
1K byte of RAM, used both for display memory and user programs
1K byte of ROM for the monitor program (not even called an operating system)
video logic and a television RF modulator, for the 16 rows of 32 characters display
a software scanned hexadecimal keypad
an optional ASCII keyboard

The major advance that the Microtan 65 had over a lot of the competition at that time was that the video display was flicker free. At the time a lot of microcomputers would either access the screen memory asynchronously to the video timing (causing flicker and splats on the screen), or would write to the screen memory during a non-display period (which was slow). The Microtan 65 got over this problem by making use of a major feature of the 6502. The 6502 (unlike most other CPUs) has a regular period in each instruction cycle when all CPU activity is inside the chip, leaving the external memory available without using complex external arbitration logic. This made video display design simpler and meant that video accesses could be made at maximum speed. This technique is also used on the ORIC and ATMOS computers.

The 32×16 characters was the reason that the 6502 was clocked at 750 kHz. To get the circuitry to work at a (nearly) standard video rate meant that the pixel clock had to be 6 MHz. When the Microtan 65 was designed only a 1 MHz 6502 was available, and so 750 kHz was used (6 MHz divided by 8).

The 1K byte monitor program (later increased to a 2K) was called TANBUG. The software facilities were rudimentary:

M = Memory modify / examine
L = List a block of memory
G = Go command (Run a program)
R = Registers display / modify
S = set Single step mode
N = set Normal mode (cancel S command)
P = Proceed command (execute next instruction in Single step mode)
B = set Breakpoints
O = calculate Offset for use in branch instructions
C = Copy a block of memory

The Microtan 65 memory map is shown below ($ representing a hexadecimal memory address):

$0000 Zero Page
$0100 Stack
$0200 Screen RAM
$0300
$0400 End of Microtan 65 RAM - map continued from $0400 to $0700 as RAM on TANEX
$8000 I/O
$C000
$F800 TANBUG V2
$FFFF
The screen memory occupies the space between $200 and $3FF. In addition to the standard 8 bits of screen RAM, there was an additional single bit RAM shadowing the $200 to $300 space. This was configured as a 9th bit write-only plane, and was used by the Microtan 65 for rudimentary, or "chunky", graphics. Setting the 9th bit displayed a Minitel type block graphic.

The display is 32 characters across by 16 lines down, with memory address $200 representing the top left hand displayed character, $220 the second row, etc. The character representation is standard ASCII. Several pieces of Microtan 65 software write to the bottom line by writing to memory starting at $3E0 - the leftmost character on the bottom line, rather than vectoring through TANBUG.

I/O in the Microtan 65 is decoded into a 16 KB space to simplify the hardware. In fact the 1 KB of RAM is mirrored through the bottom 32 KB, the I/O through the next 16 KB, and the EPROM through the top 16 KB. If you added an expansion board (see TANEX below) the decoding was modified and the wasted space reclaimed.

In common with other 6502 designs, I/O is mapped into the memory space. There is no dedicated I/O space as on the Z80, 8086 etc. The I/O ports are (when fully decoded):

Write to $BFF0 Clear Keyboard Flag (Keyboard would generate an IRQ)
Read from $BFF0 Turn Graphics On (enables "9th bit" graphics writes)
Write to $BFF1 Used by the hardware single step
Write to $BFF2 To write a scan pattern to the hex keypad (if fitted)
Write to $BFF3 Turn off Graphics (disable "9th bit" graphics writes)
Read From $BFF3 Read Keyboard Port (either keypad or ASCII keyboard)

Source: Wikipedia, "Microtan 65", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

92702.name: Junior Dessinez c'est gagné
92702.description: User review: One player tries draws the object designated on the card while the drawer's teammates try to guess what the object is. There are three catagories: personne (person), lieu (place), and chose (thing). This children's game is very similar to Pictionary.

92703.name: Cabbage Patch Kids: Adventures in the Park
92703.description:
