92990.description:
From the cover

The Art and Imagination of Dan Smith...GURPS: Krononauts...GURPS: Languages...New World of Darkness...NWoD BrisVegas Story...Retrospective: Swordbearer and Heroes of Olympus...Paranoia: Travel and Transport...Reliance on NPCs...Metagaming, Diegesis and Anachronisms...District 9 Review...Lord Orcus Listens!...Industry News

92993.name: Doshin the Giant

videogameexpansion.92994: Kyojin no Doshin Kaihō Sensen Chibikko Chikko Daishūgō

92993.description:
The main scenario of the game is that you control Doshin, a yellow giant. Doshin inhabits an island called Barudo, and the objective of the game is to encourage the four tribes to build monuments. The game is divided into days, of which the player can have an infinite number, which last 30 minutes and include changes from sunrise to sunset.

Source: Wikipedia, "Doshin the Giant", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

92994.name: Kyojin no Doshin Kaihō Sensen Chibikko Chikko Daishūgō
92994.description:
In the game, a child is told to go to sleep and is pulled out of bed and through the window, into a world of dreams. In this dream world, Doshin is now imprisoned and you can "Tinkle" 2D hearts on people and even the giant himself. The main objective of the game is to watch the 17 mini black and white movies collectively titled "More Than Giant" that were specially animated for this game. You must repeatedly go back and forth between the two disks to verify that monuments were built in game 1, and to complete tasks that the "Queen Companions" request of you. Most of the mini-movies in this game are simply stand-alone animated shorts called "more than giant' telling bits of the story of how Doshin came to be imprisoned (e.g. a boy fishing catches a giant, Doshin raises and lowers land to the sound of rap music, etc.).

Another objective is to free Doshin from his imprisonment, by causing him to grow larger than his cage. This will cause the game credits to show and can only be viewed once, unless you reset the game's saved data.

You can also gather help to free Doshin. After creating monuments in 'Doshin 1' and their counterpart pavilions, children will appear in the Expo area and you can "tinkle" on them with your hearts and they will join you, becoming what are known as Teamers or teamsters. There are two other teams you can choose from at the start of the game, and with enough pavilions completed you can battle the other teamster groups in a tinkle contest. If you win, the loser's team members become neutral and can be added to your team. You can have 6 other children on your team. This gives you 6 times more tinkling hearts when you go to try to free Doshin.

Source: Wikipedia, "Doshin the Giant", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

92995.name: Fighters of D
92995.description:
Fighters of D is a quick print-and-play one-on-one fighting card game for 2 Players using the paper-rock-scissor mechanic with a few combos. My goal is to teach my 5,5 years old boy to learn the basics, so he can ready to play Yomi, the great card game that perfectly captures the essence of a fighting game, in the future. Then Fighters of D becomes way better than I expected, that's why I release it for everyone to enjoy :)
Each Player needs a Fighter Deck (only 7 cards on 1 sheet of paper!) and 2 HP Cards.
The first Fighter loses all his/her HP loses that Round, and the first Fighter wins 2 Rounds (best of three) wins the game!

92996.name: Söhne des Lichts
92996.description:
User summary

This is the core book for the Söhne des Lichts RPG. It includes the game's rules and background material for the campaign world Mykrador.

The book covers:

Character creation and advancement
Combat
Magic
Equipment
A sample adventure
Magic items
Gods of Mykrador
Mutations, diseases and alchemy
Regions of Mykrador
A bestiary

92997.name: Fiddlers End
92997.description:
Fiddlers End is a roll and move game. Players win by either making their way around the board to the bus on square 90, or collecting three Home cards.

Players collect a card whenever they land on a Fiddlers End square. These can be taken from the pack or from an opponent. Cards are kept face down and only three may be held at any time.

However, there are also Police cards. If anyone obtains three of these they are automatically out of the game.

From the box: "Fiddlers End - a Game for All the Family - Fun on the Run"

92998.name: Rat-Man: Il gioco senza nome
92998.description:
Rat-Man - Il gioco senza nome is a collectible card game based on the comic/cartoon character Rat-Man by Leo Ortolani.

The game reflects the ambience of crazyness of the characters and the enviroment of the comic/cartoon.

Each player chooses his own main character (Rat-Man, Brakko, the Chameleon or the Clown), builds up a gag(action)-deck and a equipment-deck. The players now pick-up a card from the mission-deck.
The characters moving in the `unnamed city` (a square-map) have to accomplish the mission assigned or kill all the others characters.

92999.description:
Stalingrad: Heroes All is a supplement for NUTS! 2nd Edition. Although intended to be played from the German side, Stalingrad: Heroes All plays just as well from the Soviet side. It can also be played solo, cooperatively with all players on the same side or head to head.

Packed with 22 linked scenarios, this book covers a variety of small-unit and medium-sized actions from lunges across the Russia steppes during Fall Blau, to short sharp fights in the rubble of the Rattenkrieg, to desperate struggles for survival during the Kessel. This book also introduces several new unit types, hero characters and morale advantages.

Stalingrad - Heroes All is not a stand-alone game. You must have the core rules, NUTS! - Europe 1944, to play.
92999.name: NUTS! Stalingrad: Heroes All

93000.name: Seelow 1945
93000.description:
This small wargame simulates in 14 turns the last German resistance before Berlin.

Each turn represents 8 hours. Soviet units are Corps, German units are divisions. Each hexagon is 5 Km across.

Components: just one sheet of paper. On one side are the rules, on the other side the map (which includes the turn record chart and the terrain types) and the counters, that have to be cut out and mounted separately.
